did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: King George County (Va.) Building Plans, Woodlawn, 1933,

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: King George County (Va.) Building Plans, Woodlawn, 1933. Local government records collection, King George County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item came to the Library of Virginia in shipments of court papers from King George County.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The King George County (Va.) Building Plans, Woodlawn, 1933, consists of nine blueprint architectural drawings and plans of the historic home known as Woodlawn plantation. The original portion of the home was constructed for Colonel Thomas Turner circa 1790. The central section was built around 1841. W. Harrison Pringle, an architect with the construction firm of Muhleman and Kayhoe, Inc., executed the drawings for the restoration. These blueprints were housed in the King George County courthouse.
